result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Brian Gerhardt Wille was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Gerhardt Wille is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian Gerhardt Wille was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 will remain open for 1 year.
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to Probation today February 23, 2016 by 10:15 a.m.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Payment plan approved through Clerk of Court.
DNA surcharge.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days if requested.

-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with T. Gillis.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Brian Gerhardt Wille appeared. Case called at 9:15 am. Includes 15CF227, 15TR2727, 15TR2728, 15TR2729, 15TR2730 and 15TR2732. Atty Gherty recites agreement. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Court questions Def.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #3. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #3. On 15TR2727, NC/GNC F/F: 389.50. On 15TR2728, NC/GNC F/F 175.30. Court dismisses Count #2. Court holds Count #1 open for one year. 15TR2729, 15TR2730 and 15TR2732 are dismissed.  On 15CF227, Court orders:
1 year W/H
- 60 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs - $243.00. Payment Plan approved
- DNA Surcharge
- AODA
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No contact with T. Gillis or residence
- Restorative Justice if requested
- Sign up for probation by 10:15 am on 2/23/2016
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Pre-trial conference at 02-23-2016 09:00 am

Initial appearance on July 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,   Thomas G.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
